_package_info.description: Comprehensive world building package for post-nuclear war settings featuring irradiated wastelands, mutant creatures, survivor factions, scavenged technology, and the remnants of civilization after the Great War
_package_info.author: Storymaster

background.name: Vault Dweller
background.description: Survivor from underground bunkers built before the Great War. Sheltered from radiation but naive about wasteland dangers. Possesses pre-war knowledge and advanced technology.

background.name: Wasteland Wanderer
background.description: Nomadic survivor who travels the irradiated ruins scavenging for supplies. Hardy and resourceful, adapted to radiation and hostile environments.

background.name: Raider Warlord
background.description: Brutal leader of savage gangs who prey on weaker survivors. Commands through fear and violence, hoarding resources and slaves in fortified camps.

background.name: Brotherhood Scribe
background.description: Scholar-warrior dedicated to preserving pre-war technology and knowledge. Member of quasi-religious military order that hoards advanced weapons and equipment.

background.name: Ghoul Outcast
background.description: Radiation-mutated human with rotting flesh but extended lifespan. Immune to radiation but feared and discriminated against by normal humans.

background.name: Caravan Trader
background.description: Merchant who travels dangerous trade routes between settlements. Expert negotiator with knowledge of safe paths and valuable goods locations.

background.name: Super Mutant Outcast
background.description: Artificially created giant mutant rejected by both humans and mutant society. Possesses incredible strength but struggles with intelligence and acceptance.

background.name: Enclave Remnant
background.description: Former member of pre-war shadow government that survived in secret bunkers. Believes in human genetic purity and American restoration.

background.name: NCR Ranger
background.description: Elite scout and law enforcement officer of the New California Republic. Protects trade routes and settlements from raiders and mutant threats.

background.name: Legion Centurion
background.description: Military commander in Caesar's slaveholding empire modeled on ancient Rome. Disciplined warrior who conquers territory through organized brutality.

background.name: Tribal Shaman
background.description: Spiritual leader of primitive post-war tribe. Maintains oral traditions and interprets omens while guiding people through wasteland dangers.

background.name: Synth Infiltrator
background.description: Artificial human created by the Institute to blend into wasteland communities. Struggles with questions of identity and free will.

background.name: Minuteman Militia
background.description: Citizen-soldier defending Commonwealth settlements from threats. Responds to distress calls and helps communities organize their defenses.

background.name: Railroad Agent
background.description: Underground operative helping synthetic humans escape Institute control. Uses stealth and deception to free artificial beings from slavery.

background.name: Scavenger Boss
background.description: Leader of salvage crews who strip useful materials from pre-war ruins. Coordinates dangerous expeditions into radioactive zones for valuable tech.

background.name: Radiation Cult Prophet
background.description: Religious fanatic who worships atomic energy as divine force. Preaches that radiation purifies souls and seeks to spread the 'glow' to all.

background.name: Bounty Hunter
background.description: Freelance tracker who hunts dangerous criminals and mutants for caps. Uses advanced weapons and survival skills to survive in hostile wasteland.

background.name: Settlement Mayor
background.description: Elected leader of fortified community trying to rebuild civilization. Manages resources, trade agreements, and defense against wasteland threats.

background.name: Atom Cat Mechanic
background.description: Power armor enthusiast and expert mechanic. Member of greaser-style gang that maintains and customizes pre-war military equipment.

background.name: Talon Company Mercenary
background.description: Professional soldier-for-hire in well-equipped paramilitary organization. Takes contracts for caps regardless of moral implications.

background.name: Slave
background.description: Captured survivor forced into bondage by raiders or slavers. Dreams of freedom while enduring harsh treatment and dangerous labor.

background.name: Wastelander Doctor
background.description: Medical professional treating radiation sickness and combat injuries with limited supplies. Travels between settlements providing healing services.

background.name: Pre-War Ghoul
background.description: Ancient survivor who lived through the Great War and remembers the old world. Possesses invaluable knowledge but haunted by loss of humanity.

background.name: Gunner Veteran
background.description: Elite fighter in ruthless mercenary army. Heavily armed and armored soldier who takes any job that pays well in caps or equipment.

background.name: Children of Atom Zealot
background.description: Fanatical believer in radioactive religion. Seeks to spread atomic fire across the wasteland and views mutations as divine blessings.

background.name: Institute Scientist
background.description: Underground researcher developing advanced technology and synthetic humans. Views surface dwellers as primitive subjects for experimentation.

background.name: Crimson Caravan Guard
background.description: Armed escort protecting valuable trade caravans across dangerous wasteland routes. Fights off raiders, mutants, and hostile wildlife.

background.name: Tunnel Snake
background.description: Member of underground gang controlling subway tunnels and sewer systems. Uses knowledge of urban ruins to ambush surface dwellers.

background.name: Nightkin Berserker
background.description: Invisible super mutant driven insane by Stealth Boy addiction. Unpredictable and violent, feared even by other mutants.

background.name: Vault-Tec Overseer
background.description: Administrator of underground vault conducting social experiments on residents. Maintains order through propaganda and authoritarian control.

class.name: Wasteland Survivor
class.description: Hardy individual adapted to post-apocalyptic life. Expert at scavenging, radiation resistance, and improvised combat using whatever weapons are available.

class.name: Tech Specialist
class.description: Engineer who maintains and repairs pre-war technology. Can jury-rig equipment, hack computer terminals, and understand complex mechanical systems.

class.name: Raider
class.description: Savage marauder who takes what they want through violence and intimidation. Skilled with brutal weapons and psychological warfare tactics.

class.name: Paladin
class.description: Elite warrior-monk of the Brotherhood of Steel. Trained in power armor combat and dedicated to preserving technology from unworthy hands.
class.class_trait: Power armor mastery, energy weapons, technology lore

class.name: Ghoul
class.description: Radiation-mutated human with enhanced longevity and immunity to radiation. Feared by humans but possesses pre-war memories and experience.
class.class_trait: Radiation immunity, extended lifespan, pre-war knowledge

class.name: Super Mutant
class.description: Artificially enhanced giant with incredible strength and durability. Created through viral infection, possesses raw power but often reduced intelligence.
class.class_trait: Superhuman strength, damage resistance, intimidating presence

class.name: Courier
class.description: Professional messenger who travels dangerous routes between settlements. Expert navigator with knowledge of safe paths and local politics.

class.name: Medic
class.description: Healing specialist using pre-war medical knowledge and wasteland herbs. Treats radiation sickness, injuries, and various mutant-related conditions.
class.class_trait: Medical knowledge, radiation treatment, chemical crafting

class.name: Scavenger
class.description: Expert at finding and salvaging useful materials from ruins. Can identify valuable pre-war artifacts and knows the best scavenging locations.
class.class_trait: Salvage expertise, ruin navigation, artifact identification

class.name: Gunslinger
class.description: Master of small arms and quick-draw techniques. Deadly accurate with pistols and rifles, specializes in precision shooting and gun maintenance.
class.class_trait: Weapon accuracy, quick draw, gun maintenance

class.name: Psyker
class.description: Mutant with psychic abilities enhanced by radiation exposure. Can read minds, move objects with thought, and influence others mentally.

class.name: Tribal Warrior
class.description: Fighter from primitive post-war society using traditional weapons and tactics. Combines ancestral wisdom with wasteland survival skills.
class.class_trait: Traditional weapons, tribal lore, wilderness survival

race.name: Human
race.description: Baseline human survivors with no major mutations. Most common inhabitants of the wasteland, organizing into various factions and settlements.

race.name: Ghoul
race.description: Humans mutated by massive radiation exposure, with rotting flesh but greatly extended lifespans. Immune to radiation but feared by normal humans.

race.name: Super Mutant
race.description: Artificially created giants mutated by the Forced Evolutionary Virus. Possess incredible strength and durability but often suffer reduced intelligence.

race.name: Synth
race.description: Artificial humans created by advanced technology, indistinguishable from real people. Struggle with questions of identity and free will.

race.name: Mutant
race.description: Humans with beneficial radiation-induced mutations. May have enhanced senses, natural armor, or other adaptive advantages.

race.name: Tribal
race.description: Humans living in primitive post-war societies. Maintain oral traditions and spiritual beliefs while adapting to wasteland conditions.

sub_race.name: Feral Ghoul
sub_race.description: Ghouls who have lost their sanity to radiation exposure. Mindless and aggressive, attacking any living creature on sight.

sub_race.name: Glowing One
sub_race.description: Heavily irradiated ghouls who emit dangerous radiation. Can heal other ghouls but are lethal to normal humans.

sub_race.name: Nightkin
sub_race.description: Super mutants with blue-gray skin who used Stealth Boys extensively. Many suffer from schizophrenia and invisibility addiction.

sub_race.name: Super Mutant Behemoth
sub_race.description: Enormous super mutants who continue growing throughout their lives. Mindless giants of incredible destructive power.

sub_race.name: Generation 3 Synth
sub_race.description: Most advanced synthetic humans, completely indistinguishable from real people. Possess artificial memories and emotions.

sub_race.name: Courser
sub_race.description: Elite synthetic humans designed for combat and retrieval operations. Enhanced reflexes and combat programming.

sub_race.name: Psyker
sub_race.description: Mutants with psychic abilities including telepathy, telekinesis, and precognition. Often feared and persecuted by normal humans.

sub_race.name: Rad-Child
sub_race.description: Mutants who gain health and strength from radiation exposure. Can survive in highly contaminated areas others cannot enter.

stat.name: Radiation Resistance
stat.description: Natural immunity to radioactive contamination and ability to survive in irradiated environments without protection.

stat.name: Tech Aptitude
stat.description: Understanding of pre-war technology and ability to repair, modify, and operate complex mechanical and electronic systems.

stat.name: Wasteland Survival
stat.description: Knowledge of post-apocalyptic dangers and skills needed to survive in harsh, contaminated environments.

stat.name: Scavenging
stat.description: Ability to find useful materials and resources in ruins, debris, and abandoned locations.

stat.name: Combat Hardiness
stat.description: Physical and mental toughness developed through constant exposure to violence and danger in the wasteland.

skills.name: Radiation Detection
skills.description: Sensing dangerous levels of radioactive contamination and identifying safe areas or contaminated zones

skills.name: Scrap Electronics
skills.description: Salvaging useful components from pre-war electronic devices and jury-rigging new equipment

skills.name: Wasteland Medicine
skills.description: Treating radiation sickness, combat injuries, and various mutant-related medical conditions with limited supplies

skills.name: Power Armor Operation
skills.description: Wearing and maintaining pre-war military power armor suits with fusion core management

skills.name: Energy Weapons Maintenance
skills.description: Repairing and calibrating laser rifles, plasma guns, and other directed-energy weapons

skills.name: Mutant Tracking
skills.description: Following and identifying various mutant creatures and understanding their behavior patterns

skills.name: Settlement Defense
skills.description: Organizing community defenses against raiders, mutants, and other wasteland threats

skills.name: Radiation Cooking
skills.description: Preparing irradiated food and water to reduce contamination while preserving nutritional value

skills.name: Terminal Hacking
skills.description: Breaking into pre-war computer systems and accessing locked electronic information

skills.name: Improvised Weaponry
skills.description: Creating effective weapons from scavenged materials and household items

skills.name: Ghoul Empathy
skills.description: Understanding and communicating effectively with radiation-mutated humans

skills.name: Pre-War Lore
skills.description: Knowledge of old world history, culture, and technology before the Great War

skills.name: Caravan Trading
skills.description: Negotiating trade deals and organizing merchant expeditions across dangerous wasteland routes

skills.name: Tribal Diplomacy
skills.description: Communicating with primitive post-war societies and understanding their customs and beliefs

skills.name: Raider Psychology
skills.description: Understanding the mindset and tactics of savage wasteland gangs and marauders

faction.name: Brotherhood of Steel
faction.description: Quasi-religious military order dedicated to preserving and controlling pre-war technology. Operates from fortified bunkers with advanced power armor and energy weapons.

faction.name: New California Republic
faction.description: Democratic federation attempting to rebuild civilization based on old world American values. Controls vast territories through organized military and civilian government.

faction.name: Caesar's Legion
faction.description: Brutal slaveholding empire modeled on ancient Rome. Conquers tribes through military might and cultural assimilation under absolute dictator.

faction.name: The Enclave
faction.description: Remnants of pre-war shadow government believing in human genetic purity. Seeks to exterminate all mutants and reclaim America for 'pure' humans.

faction.name: The Institute
faction.description: Underground scientific organization creating synthetic humans and advanced technology. Views surface dwellers as primitive subjects for experimentation.

faction.name: The Railroad
faction.description: Secret network helping synthetic humans escape Institute control. Uses covert operations and safe houses to liberate artificial beings.

faction.name: The Minutemen
faction.description: Volunteer militia protecting Commonwealth settlements from threats. Responds to distress calls and helps communities organize their defenses.

faction.name: Talon Company
faction.description: Well-equipped mercenary organization taking contracts for caps. Professional soldiers-for-hire with military discipline and advanced weapons.

faction.name: The Gunners
faction.description: Ruthless mercenary army controlling territory through superior firepower. Recruits from raiders and ex-military for organized criminal operations.

faction.name: Children of Atom
faction.description: Radioactive religious cult worshipping atomic energy as divine force. Believes radiation purifies souls and seeks to spread the 'glow' to all.

faction.name: Super Mutant Army
faction.description: Military force of artificially created giants seeking to transform all humans through viral infection. Led by charismatic Master figure.

faction.name: Crimson Caravan Company
faction.description: Major trading corporation controlling commercial routes across the wasteland. Employs armed guards and maintains trading posts.

faction.name: Raiders of the Capital
faction.description: Savage gangs preying on weaker survivors through violence and intimidation. Loosely organized tribes fighting over territory and resources.

faction.name: Atom Cats
faction.description: Greaser-style gang obsessed with power armor customization and maintenance. Friendly mechanics who help others while pursuing their hobby.

faction.name: The Followers of the Apocalypse
faction.description: Humanitarian organization providing medical care and education to wasteland communities. Pacifist group dedicated to helping survivors.

faction_a_on_b_relations.relation_desc: Brotherhood of Steel views NCR's democratic ideals as chaotic and dangerous
Brotherhood of Steel seeks to destroy Institute and capture their technology
NCR and Caesar's Legion are locked in territorial war
Enclave and Institute share belief in human technological superiority
Institute hunts Railroad agents who steal their synthetic property
Railroad and Minutemen both protect innocent people from oppression
Talon Company sometimes contracts with Gunners for large operations
Children of Atom views Super Mutants as blessed by radiation
Crimson Caravan pays raiders for 'protection' on certain routes
Atom Cats and Followers share knowledge and help wasteland communities

location_.name: Vault 111
location_.description: Cryogenic preservation vault where survivors were frozen before the Great War. Most pods failed over time, leaving few living occupants.

location_.name: Diamond City
location_.description: Major settlement built inside Fenway Park baseball stadium. Heavily fortified trading hub with diverse population and strong security force.

location_.name: The Glowing Sea
location_.description: Heavily irradiated wasteland created by direct nuclear impact. Deadly radiation levels support only the most mutated creatures and plants.

location_.name: Brotherhood Bunker Alpha
location_.description: Underground military facility housing Brotherhood of Steel forces. Contains power armor bays, weapons storage, and technical workshops.

location_.name: Goodneighbor
location_.description: Ghoul-friendly settlement accepting all outcasts and criminals. Rough town with few rules but strong sense of community among rejects.

location_.name: The Institute Underground
location_.description: Advanced scientific facility beneath ruins of MIT. Clean, sterile environment housing synthetic human production and research laboratories.

location_.name: Megaton
location_.description: Settlement built around an unexploded atomic bomb. Ramshackle town of scrap metal buildings with unique circular construction.

location_.name: New Vegas Strip
location_.description: Preserved casino district powered by Hoover Dam. Glamorous entertainment center controlled by mysterious Mr. House and his robot army.

location_.name: Rivet City
location_.description: Settlement constructed inside beached aircraft carrier. Multi-level community with market, clinic, and residential areas on ship decks.

location_.name: The Pitt
location_.description: Industrial hellscape built in ruins of Pittsburgh. Slave-labor factories produce steel and ammunition under brutal raider overlords.

location_flora_fauna.description: Giant mutated scorpions with deadly poison stings and heavily armored carapaces. Hunt in packs through irradiated zones.
Cockroaches mutated by radiation to emit green bioluminescence. Harmless scavengers that feed on radioactive waste.

history.name: The Great War
history.description: Global nuclear exchange that lasted only two hours but destroyed civilization. Chinese and American nuclear arsenals reduced the world to radioactive wasteland.

history.name: Vault-Tec Experiments
history.description: Secret social and scientific experiments conducted on vault dwellers by Vault-Tec Corporation. Most vaults were designed to test human behavior under extreme conditions.

history.name: Master's Army Creation
history.description: Richard Grey creates the Forced Evolutionary Virus and begins transforming humans into super mutants. Builds army to remake humanity in his image.

history.name: NCR Foundation
history.description: Survivors in California organize into New California Republic, first post-war democratic government. Begins expansion across western territories.

history.name: Brotherhood Exodus
history.description: Brotherhood of Steel splits into factions over technology sharing policies. Eastern chapter begins long journey across the wasteland.

object_.name: Pip-Boy 3000
object_.description: Pre-war wrist-mounted computer providing health monitoring, inventory management, and map navigation. Standard equipment for vault dwellers.

object_.name: Nuka-Cola Quantum
object_.description: Rare pre-war soft drink with radioactive isotopes causing blue glow. Valuable collector's item and mild radiation source.

object_.name: T-51b Power Armor
object_.description: Pre-war military exoskeleton providing protection and strength enhancement. Requires fusion cores for power and specialized training to operate.

object_.name: Fat Man Launcher
object_.description: Shoulder-mounted catapult firing miniature nuclear warheads. Devastating weapon of mass destruction requiring rare mini-nukes as ammunition.

object_.name: Stimpak
object_.description: Pre-war medical device providing instant healing through advanced pharmaceutical injection. Essential survival tool in dangerous wasteland.

object_.name: RadAway
object_.description: Intravenous anti-radiation medication removing radioactive contamination from bloodstream. Crucial for survival in contaminated areas.

object_.name: Laser Rifle
object_.description: Pre-war energy weapon firing concentrated light beams. Reliable and accurate but requires energy cells and technical maintenance.

object_.name: Bottle Caps
object_.description: Post-war currency backed by water merchants due to difficulty counterfeiting. Standard medium of exchange throughout the wasteland.

object_.name: Holotape
object_.description: Pre-war data storage device containing audio logs, programs, or games. Valuable source of information about old world.

object_.name: Fusion Core
object_.description: Pre-war nuclear battery providing long-term power for vehicles and power armor. Extremely valuable and difficult to manufacture.

world_data.name: Radiation Levels
world_data.description: Measurement of radioactive contamination in rads per hour. Areas above 200 rads require protection, above 1000 rads are lethal to unprotected humans.

world_data.name: Pre-War Technology
world_data.description: Advanced devices from before the Great War including robots, computers, and energy weapons. Highly valued but difficult to maintain.

world_data.name: Mutation Rates
world_data.description: Percentage of population showing genetic mutations from radiation exposure. Varies by region with highest rates near ground zero sites.

world_data.name: Trade Routes
world_data.description: Established paths between settlements protected by armed guards. Essential for commerce but constantly threatened by raiders and mutants.

world_data.name: Water Sources
world_data.description: Clean water locations free from radioactive contamination. Most valuable resource in wasteland, often fought over by factions.
